revision.comment: Full date of birth as per Who Was Who entry

{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2012}} {{Infobox military person | name =Evelyn Thomson | image = | caption = | birth_date =13 April 1884 | death_date =21 December 1941 (aged 57) | birth_place = | nickname = | allegiance = {{flag|United Kingdom}} | branch = {{navy|United Kingdom}} | serviceyears = 1899â€“1939 | rank = [[Vice Admiral (Royal Navy)|Vice Admiral]] | unit = | commands = [[HMS Petard (1916)|HMS ''Petard'']]
Third Destroyer Flotilla
[[HMS St Vincent (Gosport shore establishment)|HMS ''St Vincent'']]
[[Home Fleet]] Destroyer Flotillas
[[Flag Officer Scotland, Northern England, Northern Ireland|Coast of Scotland]] | battles = [[World War I]] | awards = [[Companion of the Order of the Bath]]
[[Distinguished Service Order]] | relations = }} [[Vice Admiral (Royal Navy)|Vice Admiral]] '''Evelyn Claude Ogilvie Thomson''' [[Order of the Bath|CB]] [[Distinguished Service Order|DSO]] (13 April 1884 – 21 December 1941) was a [[Royal Navy]] officer who became [[Flag Officer Scotland, Northern England, Northern Ireland|Commander-in-Chief, Coast of Scotland]]. ==Naval career== Thomson joined the [[Royal Navy]] as a [[cadet]] in 1899.[http://www.admirals.org.uk/admirals/individual.php?RecNo=116 Royal Navy Flag Officers 1904-1945] He served in [[World War I]][http://www.kcl.ac.uk/lhcma/locreg/THOMSON.shtml Liddell Hart Centre for Military Archives] and commanded the [[destroyer]] [[HMS Petard (1916)|HMS ''Petard'']] at the [[Battle of Jutland]].[http://www.worldwar1.co.uk/despatches/battle-jutland.html World War I despatches] He was appointed Commander of the Third Destroyer Flotilla in 1926, Captain-in-charge in [[Singapore]] in 1929 and Commander of the [[HMS St Vincent (Gosport shore establishment)|HMS ''St Vincent'']] boys' training establishment in [[Gosport]] in 1932. He went on to be Commander of the [[Home Fleet]] Destroyer Flotillas in 1935 and [[Flag Officer Scotland, Northern England, Northern Ireland|Commander-in-Chief, Coast of Scotland]] in 1937.[http://www.gulabin.com/armynavy/pdf/Senior%20Royal%20Navy%20Appointments%201900-.pdf Listing compiled by historian Colin Mackie] He retired in 1939. ==Family== In 1918 he married Agnes Motherwell Wilson.[http://www.thepeerage.com/p31726.htm The Peerage.com] ==References== {{reflist|2}} {{S-start}} {{s-mil}} {{succession box|title=[[Flag Officer Scotland, Northern England, Northern Ireland|Commander-in-Chief, Coast of Scotland]]|before=[[Robert Davenport (Royal Navy officer)|Robert Davenport]]|after=[[Charles Ramsey (Royal Navy officer)|Sir Charles Ramsey]]|years=1937–1939}} {{end}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Thomson, Evelyn}} [[Category:1884 births]] [[Category:1941 deaths]] [[Category:Royal Navy admirals]] [[Category:Companions of the Order of the Bath]] [[Category:Companions of the Distinguished Service Order]] [[Category:People educated at Stubbington House School]] [[Category:Royal Navy officers of World War I]]
